block.p: Rebecca Jane Hooper, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carroll B. Hooper of Midlothian, Va., was married yesterday to David Bayer Horner, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Horner of Washington. The Rev. Dr. O. Benjamin Sparks performed the ceremony at the Second Presbyterian Church in Richmond, Va.

Mrs. Horner, 29, is the chief operating officer of the Autism Center of Virginia at Virginia Commonwealth University in Richmond. She is also a lecturer in management information systems at the University of Virginia in Charlottesville, from which she graduated and received a Master of Education degree. Her father retired as the president of McGraw Morgan Inc., a mechanical engineering concern in Powhatan, Va.

Mrs. Horner, 29, is the chief operating officer of the Autism Center of Virginia at Virginia Commonwealth University in Richmond. She is also a lecturer in management information systems at the University of Virginia in Charlottesville, from which she graduated and received a Master of Education degree. Her father retired as the president of McGraw Morgan Inc., a mechanical engineering concern in Powhatan, Va.

Mr. Horner, 31, received a law degree in May from Washington and Lee University. Next month, he is to become an associate at LeClair Ryan, a law firm in Richmond. He graduated from Kenyon College and received a master's degree in politics from Oxford University in England.

The bridegroom's mother, Constance Horner, is a guest scholar at the Brookings Institution in Washington. She was a deputy secretary of health and human services and later the director of the Office of Personnel Management in the Bush administration. His father is a senior fellow at the Hudson Institute in Washington; he was a deputy assistant secretary of state from 1981 to 1985 and the associate director of the United States Information Agency from 1985 to 1991.
